column4: ok how to deal with this error message no matter what package i try to install it's always the same
dpkg: error processing /var/cache/apt/archives/system-tools-backends_2.6.0-1ubuntu1.1_i386.deb (--unpack):
trying to overwrite `/usr', which is the diverted version of `/.' (package: /usr/bin)
i have already
error remains
Try aptitude update?
Did you install any weird software?
What does dpkg-divert --list /usr say?
That's,hm. dpkg -l /usr/bin, what does that say?
Hm. Okay, well. Go look in /var/lib/dpkg/diversions
You should find that diversion somewhere in there.
Should look like /usr\n/.\n/usr/bin
Or, hm. How big is that file?
Can you mail it to me at gcbirzan@gmail.com?
You managed to screw up that file completely. :-)
Look in diversions-old
Paste me the first 3 lines of that in /msg
Perfect. Copy that file over the diversionsone.
Almost everything should start working after that.
what was the last package you installed
Ah, duh. Well, that package is probably buggy
True. But, hm. I fail at the ubuntu bug thingy
you're the best :) everything is working again :) thanks a lot :)
Btw, you should report this bug
